chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof starting with "```coq
", ending with "Qed.```", without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Your Response:
```coq
simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

Your Response:
```coq
intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Solve This Proof State:

Hypotheses:
None

Goal:
r_antisymmetric bool lem

Premises:
Inductive bool : Set := true : bool | false : bool
r_antisymmetric : forall A : Set, mRelation A -> Prop
lem_reflexive = fun x : Map bool => Map_ind bool (fun x0 : Map bool => lem x0 x0) I (fun (a : ad) (a0 : bool) => eq_ind_r (fun b : bool => if b then leb a0 a0 else False) (leb_reflexive a0) (N.eqb_refl a)) (fun (m : Map bool) (H : lem m m) (m0 : Map bool) (H0 : lem m0 m0) => conj H H0) x : r_reflexive bool lem
lem = fix lem (m0 m1 : Map bool) {struct m1} : Prop := match m0 with | @M0 _ => match m1 with | @M0 _ => True | _ => False end | @M1 _ a b => match m1 with | @M1 _ a' b' => if (a =? a')%N then leb b b' else False | _ => False end | @M2 _ a b => match m1 with | @M2 _ c d => lem a c /\ lem b d | _ => False end end : Map bool -> Map bool -> Prop
Inductive ascii : Set := Ascii : bool -> bool -> bool -> bool -> bool -> bool -> bool -> bool -> Ascii.ascii For Ascii: Argument scopes are [bool_scope bool_scope bool_scope bool_scope bool_scope bool_scope bool_scope bool_scope]
Inductive bool : Set := true : bool | false : bool
ssrbool.addb = fun b : bool => if b then negb else fun x : bool => x : bool -> bool -> bool Argument scopes are [bool_scope bool_scope]
orb = fun b1 b2 : bool => if b1 then true else b2 : bool -> bool -> bool Argument scopes are [bool_scope bool_scope]
implb = fun b1 b2 : bool => if b1 then b2 else true : bool -> bool -> bool Argument scopes are [bool_scope bool_scope]
andb = fun b1 b2 : bool => if b1 then b2 else false : bool -> bool -> bool Argument scopes are [bool_scope bool_scope]
Bvector.Bcons : bool -> forall n : nat, Vector.t bool n -> Vector.t bool (S n)
Bvector.BVxor : forall n : nat, Vector.t bool n -> Vector.t bool n -> Vector.t bool n
negb = fun b : bool => if b then false else true : bool -> bool Argument scope is [bool_scope]
eqb = fun b1 b2 : bool => if b1 then if b2 then true else false else if b2 then false else true : bool -> bool -> bool Argument scopes are [bool_scope bool_scope]
xorb = fun b1 b2 : bool => if b1 then if b2 then false else true else if b2 then true else false : bool -> bool -> bool Argument scopes are [bool_scope bool_scope]
leb = fun b0 b1 : bool => if b0 then if b1 then True else False else if b1 then True else True : bool -> bool -> Prop Argument scopes are [bool_scope bool_scope]
Nat.b2n = fun b : bool => if b then 1 else 0 : bool -> nat Argument scope is [bool_scope]
BinInt.Z.b2z = fun b : bool => if b then Zpos 1 else Z0 : bool -> Z Argument scope is [bool_scope]
Bvector.Bvect_true : forall n : nat, Vector.t bool n
Bvector.Bvector = Vector.t bool : nat -> Set Argument scope is [nat_scope]
in_dom : forall A : Type, ad -> Map A -> bool
Init.Nat.even = fix even (n : nat) : bool := match n with | 0 => true | 1 => false | S (S n') => even n' end : nat -> bool Argument scope is [nat_scope]
List.existsb : forall A : Type, (A -> bool) -> list A -> bool
Init.Nat.testbit = fix testbit (a n : nat) {struct n} : bool := match n with | 0 => Init.Nat.odd a | S n0 => testbit (Init.Nat.div2 a) n0 end : nat -> nat -> bool Argument scopes are [nat_scope nat_scope]
BinNatDef.N.odd = fun n : N => negb (BinNatDef.N.even n) : N -> bool Argument scope is [N_scope]
Init.Nat.odd = fun n : nat => negb (Init.Nat.even n) : nat -> bool Argument scope is [nat_scope]
bool_ind : forall P : bool -> Prop, P true -> P false -> forall b : bool, P b
Nless_aux = fix Nless_aux (a a' : N) (p : positive) {struct p} : bool := match p with | (p'~0)%positive => Nless_aux (N.div2 a) (N.div2 a') p' | _ => negb (N.odd a) && N.odd a' end : N -> N -> positive -> bool Argument scopes are [N_scope N_scope positive_scope]
FSetPositive.PositiveSet.mem = fix mem (i : FSetPositive.PositiveSet.elt) (m : FSetPositive.PositiveSet.t) {struct m} : bool := match m with | FSetPositive.PositiveSet.Leaf => false | FSetPositive.PositiveSet.Node l o r => match i with | (i0~1)%positive => mem i0 r | (i0~0)%positive => mem i0 l | 1%positive => o end end : FSetPositive.PositiveSet.elt -> FSetPositive.PositiveSet.t -> bool
BinNatDef.N.eqb = fix eqb (n m : N) {struct n} : bool := match n with | 0%N => match m with | 0%N => true | N.pos _ => false end | N.pos p => match m with | 0%N => false | N.pos q => (p =? q)%positive end end : N -> N -> bool Argument scopes are [N_scope N_scope]
FSetPositive.PositiveSet.equal = fix equal (m m' : FSetPositive.PositiveSet.t) {struct m} : bool := match m with | FSetPositive.PositiveSet.Leaf => FSetPositive.PositiveSet.is_empty m' | FSetPositive.PositiveSet.Node l o r => match m' with | FSetPositive.PositiveSet.Leaf => FSetPositive.PositiveSet.is_empty m | FSetPositive.PositiveSet.Node l' o' r' => if if eqb o o' then equal l l' else false then equal r r' else false end end : FSetPositive.PositiveSet.t -> FSetPositive.PositiveSet.t -> bool
FSetPositive.PositiveSet.subset = fix subset (m m' : FSetPositive.PositiveSet.t) {struct m} : bool := match m with | FSetPositive.PositiveSet.Leaf => true | FSetPositive.PositiveSet.Node l o r => match m' with | FSetPositive.PositiveSet.Leaf => FSetPositive.PositiveSet.is_empty m | FSetPositive.PositiveSet.Node l' o' r' => if if if negb o then true else o' then subset l l' else false then subset r r' else false end end : FSetPositive.PositiveSet.t -> FSetPositive.PositiveSet.t -> bool

```coq
Definition r_antisymmetric_bool_lem : Prop := 
forall m0 m1 : Map bool,
lem m0 m1 -> lem m1 m0 -> m0 = m1.

Proof.
introv Hlem Hlem'.
induction Hlem; inversion Hlem';
try solve [apply f_equal; eauto; try reflexivity; eauto].

(* Base case *)
- destruct m0; destruct m1; simpl; eauto.

(* Inductive step *)
- destruct m0; destruct m1; simpl; eauto.
  + apply f_equal; eauto; try reflexivity; eauto.
  + apply f_equal; eauto; try reflexivity; eauto.
Qed.

original: Definition r_antisymmetric_bool_lem : Prop := forall m0 m1 : Map bool, lem m0 m1 -> lem m1 m0 -> m0 = m1. introv Hlem Hlem'. induction Hlem; inversion Hlem'; try solve [apply f_equal; eauto; try reflexivity; eauto]. - destruct m0; destruct m1; simpl; eauto. - destruct m0; destruct m1; simpl; eauto. + apply f_equal; eauto; try reflexivity; eauto. + apply f_equal; eauto; try reflexivity; eauto.
